intro: Puccinellia chinampoensis, commonly known as the Chinese puccinellia, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in saline or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across coastal and marshy areas. Puccinellia chinampoensis plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and is often found in wetland ecosystems.
